attributes.action: Care and support worker should be paid at lease £15 per hour
attributes.background: To look into care and support worker, nurses and any other carers who is at the forefront of this covid-19.  The government should pass a law that no carer should be paid anything less than £15.00 per hour.

rejection.details:
The Government sets a National Minimum Wage and National Living Wage that set minimum wages for people of different age groups, and apprentices. The Government does not set minimum wages for particular groups of workers. These are a matter for individual employers, sometimes in negotiation with trade unions or other bodies.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to give all key workers a 100% tax and Nat. Ins. holiday through COVID-19 crisis, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306845

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
